channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2023091002
item.description:
Report X-2023091002

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DRUM WAS PICKED UP ON UNLOAD PUNCTURED AND LEAKING DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION FOUND THE DRUM HAD BEEN DROPPED OFF OF THE ROLLER LINE AND FELL ON A SCREW FOR THE ROLLERLINE WHICH PUNCTURED IT AND ALLOWED IT TO LEAK DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: RED TOTE

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE JERRICAN WAS FOUND IN THE LOAD SIDE DURING THE PRELOAD SORT. DescribePack: THE JERRICAN WAS PUNCTURED AND LEAKED OUT. IT'S NOT POSSIBLE TO SEND IT TO THE RECIPIENT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE JERRICAN WAS WRAPPED IN PLASTIC TO PREVENT MORE SPILLAGE

item.title: Report E-2023090851
item.description:
Report E-2023090851

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: CUMBERLAND
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 08/31/2023, at 0619, personnel in the CSXT Cumberland Yard discovered UTLX 755938, a residue tank car of Petroleum Gases, Liquified, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Maryland Department of the Environment, and National Response Center were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2023-0831-00068). The local fire department responded to the site and observed the A-End liquid valve partially open and secondary closure plug less than tool tight, and actively releasing lading. Specialized Professional Services, Inc., a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and confirmed a partially open liquid valve and less than tool tight secondary closure plug. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper, Mr. Jeff Dean of Tri Gas and Oil, phone 410-310-6354. Contractor personnel closed the valve and properly installed the secondary closure plug, thus securing the release. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 119 NARRI: 90
